Name: Torso of a statue of Tjy-an-em-ho-emmu
Description: Torso of a statue with inscribed back pillar. Head and neck as well as the upper part of the back pillar are missing. On the left shoulder, a schematically modelled scarab is partly worked in the stone; the front pair of legs is stretched out sideways over its head. Underneath the broad and flattened chest, but not on the back, is the upper seam of a kilt, knotted in the middle. The shoulders are wide and rounded and the muscular upper arms are joined to the body.The figure has a wide back pillar, which probably originally ended in a truncated triangle.
